casebody.data:
John D. Demarest, Appellant v. William Koch, impleaded, Respondent. Decided May 5, 1890. Appeal from a.judgment entered in favor of defendant Koch against plaintiff on the report of a referee. S. V. R. Cooper, for appellant. Augustus Ford, for respondent.

Before Truax and Dugro, JJ. The question involved was whether under the provisions of a certain contract, Koch, one of the parties thereto, was liable to third parties as" a partner with the other party thereto.

The Court (Per Curiam)

held he was not, and affirmed the judgment.
